column1: Nangi railway station is a Kolkata Suburban Railway Station on the Sealdah–Budge Budge line with an approximate 23 kilometres (14 mi) distance from Sealdah railway station. It is under the jurisdiction of Eastern Railway zone of Indian Railways. Nangi railway station is one of the busiest railway stations of Sealdah railway division. More than 45 pairs of E.M.U. local trains pass through the railway station on a daily basis. It is situated in South 24 Parganas district in the Indian State of West Bengal. Nangi railway station serves Nangi town and the surrounding areas.
Nangi railway station is located at 22°30′00″N 88°13′24″E. It has an average elevation of 9 metres (30 ft).

column2: the Eastern Bengal Railway constructed a 1
column3: 676 mm (5 ft 6 in) wide Broad Gauge Railway from Sealdah to Nangi.

column1: Electrification from Sealdah to Nangi was completed with 25 kV AC overhead system in 1965–66.
